meanings.definition: In a peevish or bad-tempered manner.
meanings.sent1: She stomped pettishly when she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: He sighed pettishly as he waited in line.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed pettishly when its food bowl was empty.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered pettishly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The child pouted pettishly after being told no.

meanings.sent1: Her pettishly folded arms showed her annoyance.
meanings.sent2: The man's pettishly tapping foot revealed his impatience.
meanings.sent3: The dog gave a pettishly annoyed bark at the mailman.
meanings.sent4: The car engine made a pettishly sputtering sound.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's pettishly raised eyebrow silenced the class.
